name: Homemade Japanese Curry
author: partumvir
summary: Curry has always been a passion of mine, especially Japanese Curry. After years of searching I have discovered the perfect Japanese Curry. Many of these spices can be found at your local Asian, Hispanic, or Middle Eastern markets, or substituted with S&B® Oriental Curry Powder. Well worth the effort - your family will love this! Serve over steamed rice or noodles.
ingredients: 2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
8  carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
4  potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes, or more to taste
3  green bell peppers, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Combine coriander seeds, fenugreek seeds, cumin seeds, cardamom pods, and fennel seeds in a large skillet over low heat; toast until lightly golden, 1 to 2 minutes
Add cloves, star anise, and cinnamon sticks; toast until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes
Remove seeds from cardamom pods and return to the skillet, discarding pods
Transfer toasted spice mixture to a spice grinder or blender
Add turmeric, white peppercorns, black peppercorns, allspice, and nutmeg; grind into a fine curry powder
Melt 3/4 cup butter in a saucepan over medium heat
Whisk in flour and cook until golden brown, 30 to 45 seconds
Stir in 4 tablespoons of the curry powder, Worcestershire sauce, and tomato paste
Melt 1/2 cup butter in a large pot over low heat
Add onions; cook and stir until golden brown, 30 to 45 minutes
Increase heat to high; add 2 tablespoons curry powder, chicken, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and salt
Saute until chicken is browned, about 5 minutes
Add chicken broth and bouillon cubes; bring curry to a boil
Stir carrots into the pot; cook until tender, about 5 minutes
Add potatoes; cook until tender, about 5 minutes
Stir in green bell peppers and apples
Stir in curry paste and simmer until sauce thickens and flavors combine, about 5 minutes
